snippet: Despite the diminished state of late-night television, and technology that has altered viewing habits, the “Tonight” show remains one of the signature franchises of broadcasting and still carries unusual resonance.
abstract: Jay Leno prepares for his final appearance as host of The Tonight Show, following 22 years in which he dominated ratings; Leno's show remains one of the signature franchises of broadcasting and still carries unusual resonance, despite diminished state of late-night television; departure paves way for generational shift as 39-year-old Jimmy Fallon takes reins.
lead_paragraph: Despite the diminished state of late-night television, and technology that has altered viewing habits, the “Tonight” show remains one of the signature franchises of broadcasting and still carries unusual resonance.

headline.main: Subdued Send-Off, but Jay Leno Is Exiting on Top
headline.print_headline: Subdued Send-Off, but Leno Is Exiting on Top
